title.narrative: Save the children activities in Syria and the region, 2020

description.narrative: Save the children acitivites in Syria and the region, 2010 - Advancing localization of quality integrated child protection, education and MHPSS responses in Northern Syria

organisation.narrative: Humanitarian Action, Civil Society and Engagement

description.narrative: FL §06.39.03.11 Other contributions to acute and prolonged crises

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: 2. Advance the localization of a child rights-based response in northern Syria by strengthening technical and operational capacity of local actors, investing in principled partnerships and coordination, and increasing participation of affected communities.
Training report/attendance sheets Meeting minutes Documented updated pathway map

1. Strengthen the protective learning environment and increase the immediate and longer-term safety, and resilience of conflict-affected and marginalised girls and boys, through integrated and community-centred prevention and response services
Outputs
3.1 Key conflict-affected infrastructure for children rehabilitated to increase access and safety
# of spaces (i.e. schools/learning spaces, CFS/AFS, play areas, community centres, lighting, and sanitation facilities) rehabilitated/upgraded [target: 10]

2.1 CP and Education actors have improved capacity to establish and/or scale up a quality case management response (incl. COVID-19 adapted remote delivery) and related specialized interventions, in coordination with inter-agency structures and working group/cluster-level plans and priorities.

# of staff and partners trained on S2P [target: 100 (40F; 60M)] # of staff (including partner staff) regularly accessing coaching and supervision support [target: 100 (40F; 60M)] # of new or updated mapping of child-safe services and referral pathways completed [target: 2]
3.2 Dedicated resources, incl. cash, deployed to address urgent needs and mitigate negative coping mechanisms.
# of HHs supported to cope/recover from a sudden shock or crisis [target: 1400 HH]
2.2 New/existing community-based mechanisms, i.e. child/adolescent clubs, CPCs and PTAs, are trained and receive ongoing support to monitor, prevent and safely identify and respond to local CP risks

# of members of community-based mechanisms trained on CP topics, incl. Safe Identification and Referral (SIR), CPiE and/or Child Safeguarding [target: 201 (98F; 103M)] # of groups/committees supported to ensure community-level participation in prevention/response to CP and MHPSS risks [target: 7] # of referrals made by community-based CPCs [target: 175] # of CP assessments/monitoring reports produced [target: 4]
2.4 Targeted partners receive technical /operational capacity development to meet selfidentified needs and increase engagement with coordination structures
# of capacity building grants (based on capacity building plans) awarded to new partners [target: 10] % of local partner reporting satisfaction with their engagement with the WGs [target: 70%]

2.3 Improved capacity of front-line education + other sector staff (e.g. emergency response teams, etc.) and partners to expand/strengthen protective environment for children in nonformal learning settings

3. Reduce risks and mitigate the effects of sudden shocks or acute crises on conflict affected and marginalized children and families in northern Syria through rehabilitation of key child-focused infrastructure and improved emergency response.

Rehab assessment reports
Post-distribution/response household survey

1.2 Conflict-affected and marginalized girls and boys, and their caregivers, access gendersensitive preventative and responsive protection and resilience-building interventions through static and mobile approaches

# of girls/boys, women/men, receiving PSS services [target: 4250 (1487 girls / 1487 boys, 638 women / 638 men)] # of child/adolescent led awareness-raising events [target: 13] % of children and youth with enhanced wellbeing, resilience and coping skills [target: 60%]
Means of verification: Attendance sheets Event reports/attendance sheets Pre/post-survey
1.3 Community mobilised to mitigate MHPSS risks and promote positive MHPSS wellbeing of children and young people

% of trained staff and relevant stakeholders using new skills and knowledge for identification and prevention of MHPSS risks (incl. suicide) [target: 60%] # of learning events (internal/external) on the contextualization and rollout of suicide guidelines [target: 7] # of child/youth club members and adult focal points trained on peer-to-peer PFA [target: 138 (65 girls/ 65 boys; 4 women / 4 men)] # of community members reached with community mental health awareness information [target: 2000 (1200F; 800M]
Children at risk of violence, neglect, exploitation and family separation, and their caregivers, have improved access to quality gender and age appropriate specialized CP services

# of girls and boys receiving specialised CP services via case management (incl. alternative care) [target: 900 (450F; 450 M)] % of boys and girls and male and female caregivers satisfied with quality of support received from caseworker [target: 75%]
Means of verification: Case management database/ CPIMS+ Satisfaction survey
1.4 Conflict-affected and marginalized children, incl. those out of school, have increased access to protective learning environments

% of boys and girls in supported learning spaces regularly attending 70% of the classes or more [target: 70%] # of enrolled students provided with learning material (sex, level of education) [target: 3150 (1669F; 1481M)] # of teachers trained in SELF curriculum [target: 35 (11F; 24M)] # of students reached with explicit classroom based/ adapted SEL content [target: 2205 (1187F; 1018M)] # of learning spaces with school safety plans [target: 10]
